DOC.detailed_description: The incidence gastroesophageal reflux disease ( GERD ) rise among Asian population . A recent systematic review show among Chinese population , prevalence GERD 5 % ( 2 ) . Currently , standard treatment GERD acid suppression use proton pump inhibitor ( PPI ) achieve symptomatic relief 90 % . However , 50 % patient GERD require long term PPI . As usual occurrence GERD age 40 50 , need long term PPI among young adult render play sick role long period time . This imposed major impact patient ’ quality life , significant medical expenditure society . Since Rudolf Nissen first report use fundoplication treatment gastroesophageal reflux disease 1956 , development variety different fundoplication . It classify complete partial wrap low esophageal sphincter around esophago-gastric junction ( EGJ ) . From result numerous randomized study , Fundoplication consider alternative long term proton pump inhibitor . Recent controversy abound upon use partial complete fundoplication . Several randomized study report partial fundoplication reduce incidence post-operative dysphagia . However , benefit off-set increase incidence recurrence . From retrospective review 28 patient treat laparoscopic fundoplication , recurrence GERD significantly high patient treat partial compare complete fundoplication . The effectiveness partial complete Nissen fundoplication control reflux among Chinese patient still unknown . Our study aim compare Laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication Anterior partial control gastroesophageal reflux disease .
